text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the determination of whether the drunk driver's actions were an intervening cause is *partially dependent on how long the chair was in the road prior to the swerving* (to determine if the driver could reasonably have seen it in time to avoid it without swerving). The candidate answer analyzes the causation by treating the chair's fall as an 'act of nature' and focuses on the foreseeability of the *swerving* action itself, concluding that the chain is not broken regardless of the time the chair was present. It does not discuss the relevance of the time the chair was on the road in relation to the driver's ability to avoid it without swerving, which is the specific point required by the criterion.", "criterion_id": "53430ddb-2da1-464a-af19-ff799ad6064e"}
